intro: Rosa canina var. roffavieri, commonly known as the Roffavéri dog rose, is a botanical variant of the common dog rose. It is characterized by its pale pink to white flowers and is native to southern Europe. The plant typically grows as a shrub with thorny stems and compound leaves. Its fruit, known as a hip, is an orange-red aggregate fruit that develops after flowering. This variety is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and historical significance in botanical studies.
